description.narrative: Women and Youth political and economic empowerment enabled to effectively participate in the future socioeconomic and political development of Sudan, and strengthened and advisory support services for transitional government provided.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.1 Number of training workshops to promote awareness on women economic, political and social right organized? 1.2 Number of debates forum organized with SNHRC on transitional justice mechanism using experiences /example.
1.3 Number of women trained on vocational and entrepreneurship skills. 1.4 Number of awareness raising activity conducted for CSOs on S/GBV and preventive measures; to facilitate an access to justice and legal aid to women. 2.1: number of youths trained in collaborative leadership, design thinking, entrepreneurship. etc 2.2 number of youths trained in local governance. 2.3 Extent of progress on economic empowerment of youth through formation and providing access to fund strengthened Rating scale (1 to 4) 1= Not Adequately, 2= Very Partially, 3= Partially; 4= Largely 2.3: Number of training on innovative solutions and support on SDGs funding provided. 3.1: Report on inclusive growth and income generation produced (Yes, No) 3.2 Report on renewable energy prepared (Yes, No) 3.3 Extent of progress on expertise provided to transitional government (1 to 4) 1= Not Adequately, 2= Very Partially, 3= Partially; 4= Largely.

comment.narrative:
1.1: Women political and economic empowerment enabled: 1.1.1: Recruit Individual Consultant. 1.1.2: Establish women and socio-economic and political group network. 1.1.3: Undertake development of TOT and conduct training programme for self-employment groups of women (small entrepreneurs); on how to start and maintain and grow their businesses, including how to approach micro-finance and access their services. 1.1.4: Promote modern and innovative technology of mobile sales points, and support platforms for saving, mobilization and transfer of money.
1.2: Advocacy and mobilization strategy for (40%) of women population strengthened: 1.2.1: Conduct awareness session with political parties and CSO on the role of women in the new parliament. 1.2.2: Develop capacity of women in political parties and CSOs in the area of legislation, oversight, budgeting and decision making, gender equality and policy dialogue and governance.
2.1: Skills and competencies of youth improved: 2.1.1:Train youth in collaborative leadership, design thinking, entrepreneurship, civic engagement, public and gender advocacy. 2.1.2: Train youth in local governance .and conduct youth policy forums.
2.2: Youth learning programme network strengthened: 2.2.1: Conduct ecosystem mapping of YLP, prototypes solution and youth aspiration. 2.2.2: Accelerate youth SDGs projects and solutions through incubation and seeds funding.
2.3: Youth innovative knowledge sharing platforms established: 2.3.1: Improve on service delivery of YLP modules and expand them to become manuals. 2.3.2: Experiment and test the manuals through the YLP workshops organized and incorporate feedbacks.
3.1: National expertise to transitional government in diverse areas for visioning exercise provided: 3.1.1: conduct workshops on public finance management, inclusive peace building, visioning …etc. 3.1.2: Provide national/ international expertise to transitional government in diverse areas: a. Renewable energy, b. Employment c. Peacebuilding d. Parliamentary support

Output 1: Women political and economic empowerment enabled to effective participation in the future socio-economic and political development of Sudan, and strengthened advocacy capacity for gender equality in economy and policies: 1.1: Conducted 25 Awareness sessions divided into Four states (Khartoum - North Darfur - South Darfur – River Nile). The sessions targeted displaced persons and women, with a number of 30 people for each session. 1.2.: Provided legal services for women and displaced persons, includes representing in court and legal consultation; the achievement was. • Khartoum State: 51 legal services. • North Darfur State has 57 legal services. • South Darfur State: 89 legal services. • Nile River State: 49 legal services (126 Court cases, 10 Legal procedure and 110 Consultation). 1.3: Updating a training manual to comply with the training workshops, 120 training manuals were printed and distributed to Paralegals in all targeted areas as follows: • The rights of the displaced persons in international conventions • The rights of the displaced persons in national legislations • The concept of violence and its types • Legal procedures in case of violence • Legal protection • Related Sudanese law 1.4: Five awareness sessions on GBV and Retention of Evidence, targeting women particularly and the community in general were conducted in the following five states: (Alfoula, Aldeain, Nayala, Kosti and Khartoum) with a number of 50 Attendees for each. 1.5: UNDP held an open day in Omdurman Prison for Women in conjunction with International Womens Day. The program included an awareness session on womens rights, GBV, The Sudanese criminal law, and the criminal procedures. The internal prison regulations were also discussed. The lectures targeted inmates and prison officers. all of them have participated to identify the types of problems they face in prison. 1.6: A pamphlet on the Gender Based Violence were prepared containing the definition, basics and types of violence, methods of dealing with cases of GBV, the necessary measures and the legal procedures. 500 copy of the pamphlet was printed and distributed in the GBV lectures that were held in the four states. Also, two pamphlets were prepared on the Domestic Service Law of 1955 and the Domestic Service Law for State of Khartoum of 2009, which focused on the basic rights in the law and the definition of the domestic service work contract and its implications. 250 of each pamphlet were printed and distributed in the awareness sessions and the targeted areas.
Output 2: Youth political and economic empowerment stimulated for better utilization of their energy; transform Sudan into more inclusive and effective management developed: 2.1.1: 2000 youth training in: Development & SDGs, Community solutions leveraging innovation design thinking, Gender mainstreaming 2.2.2: 200 Youth trained in governance and peacebuilding from resistance committees and sensitivity training, collaborative leadership to manage diversity and introduction to civic engagement. 2.2.3: Youth Policy forums conducted in 18 states. 2.2.4: 200 youth trained in an advanced training in one of the following categories: • Civil society and political participation: this training will empower youth in the importance of Civic organizations duties and types. It will also develop their skills in navigating the importance of political participation and democracy. • Entrepreneurship and SMEs: this training will harness the skills of youth in the area of Entrepreneurship in how to manage and develop a business utilizing human centred design. It will also incorporate the role of entrepreneurship in poverty reduction. • Peacebuilding: this training programme will focus in the role of youth in peacebuilding and they can influence the peace process and advocate for do no harm concept. • SDG & public policies and governance: this training will enhance youth skills in how to develop and participate in policy development and implementation. It will also enhance knowledge on the importance of governance and youth roles in governance. 2.2.1: 200 community solutions will be mapped and catalogued from 14 states in Sudan. 2.3.1: 4 modules experimented on and developed.
Output 3: Advisory Support Services provided : UNDP supported the Change and Freedom to do the following: 3.1: Urgent needs and priorities for the Sudan’s Transitional Period developed and published. 3.2: The three years thematic Plans developed through intensive consultations with different sectors (32 workshops) and published. 3.3: Engagement of different ministries and government institutions in the process ensured.
The project has been operationally closed by the end of December 2019 and no activities in 2020.
The project has been operationally closed by the end of December 2019 and no activities in 2020.
The project has been operationally closed by the end of December 2019 and no activities in 2021.
The project has been operationally closed by the end of December 2019 and no activities in 2021.
